acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: There were no mortalities detected following exposure for 7 hours to a vapour saturated atmosphere at 20degC (6.55 mg/L; 4 h conversion, 7.86 mg/L) (ECETOC TR95 vol. 2 (2005)). However, classification is not possible based only on this data.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Its rat LD50 value of 1000 - 1500 mg/kg (ECETOC TR95 vol. 2 (2005)) is equivalent to the guidance value of Category 4.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: In all test methods, its flash point was 110degC or more.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since there is no available in vivo mutagenicity test data, and also there is no available in vitro mutagenicity test data with multiple indices, classification is not possible.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure in the molecule

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine) which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In a 2-generation continuous breeding test in which mice received the substance via drinking water, parental body weight and fertility index were reduced, and in high-dose groups in the F1 generation, no animal became pregnant, and at the two lower dose levels, the number of litters per pair and the number of viable animals per litter were severely reduced (ECETOC TR95 vol. 2 (2005)). Also, in many tests in which animals orally received the substance during the organogenetic period, an increase in the number of resorptions and of malformed fetuses was noted, and in rats, hydronephrosis, limb and cardiac malformations, and in mice, digit and paw malformations have been reported (ECETOC TR95 vol. 2 (2005)). Furthermore, after oral exposure in male rats, testicular atrophy, damage, and loss of spermatocytes were seen (ECETOC TR95 vol. 2 (2005)). On the other hand, in humans, multiple epidemiological studies reported abortion and fetal malformations (ECETOC TR95 vol. 2 (2005)). Since, as described above, animal tests have obviously showed effects on parental fertility and development of fetuses, and also in humans, suggested adverse effects on the development of children, the substance was classified into Category 1B. As relevant information, the substance is rated R61-62, classified into Category 2 in the EU classification.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since its pH value was 1.6 (100 g/L) (GESTIS (accessed in August 2008)), and it is documented that the substance was corrosive to rabbit skin (ECETOC TR95 vol. 2 (1995)), the substance was classified into Category 1.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since it is documented that the substance was corrosive to rabbit skin (ECETOC TR95 vol. 2 (1995)), its pH value was 1.6 (100 g/L) (GESTIS (accessed in August 2008)), and it is rated R34 in the EU classification, the substance was classified into Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (central nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on that in a rat oral administration test, at doses of 1000 and 1500 mg/kg bw (LD50 values) equivalent to the guidance values of Category 2, central nervous symptoms (convulsions, paresis, and atonia) were reported (ECETOC TR95 vol. 2 (2005)), the substance was classified into Category 2 (central nervous system).
